Name: Pulp Fiction: A Quentin Tarantino Screenplay

Author.Name: A. Braunsdorf
Author.Location: UNIX Systems Administrator in Purdue University

ReviewList.Text: Tarentino is a true master of the spoken word.  The characters are multi-dimesional and it's difficult to get bored.  The humor is overwhelmingly funny at times and keeps the story moving at a very good  pace.  The story alone makes this a must-have but throw in Tarentinos wit  and ability and you have an instant classic, somthing that doesen't come  around that often.

The movie was outstanding and I think reading the screenplay was almost as fun.  It's remarkably easy to catch the characters attitudes and even to picture them saying the lines without having seen the film.  This is one of the greatest films and screenplays of all time and it makes for perfect reading at any time of boredom or low feeling.

one of the best screenplays from one of the best movies of our time.quentin tarantino writes with authority and his own style.the screenplay is great to read but no screenplay is better than the movie.it has some scenes that were deleted from the movie and the screenplay allows  you to clearly understand some of the dialogue you cant really hear in the  movie.it also comes with some black and white pictures.excellent script.

Author.Name: Allen Smalling
Author.Location: Retired in Chicago,  IL United States

ReviewList.Text: This book exemplifies Tarantino's genius at work. This is easily one of the defining films of the 1990's, and put Tarantino on the map as one of the finest writers, as well as directirs, of this generation.

the wonderful thing about reading the screenplay for such a famous movie is to see how things/personalities/etc. got adapted. you can let your own imagination play and still compare it to what is produced by another artist... i love the film, i love the screen play. it's one of the greatest stories told about survival in a world full with coincidences and power relations that are far from linear... brilliant =)

The price was right and the product was great. It's fun reading how Tarantino sets up a scene with his description. I actually read the script before I watched the movie and it made it so much more entertaining. If you're also someone who's into screenwriting as a hobby or profession, it's worth checking out how Tarantino does it.

Tarantino's rich, exciting dialogue comes to life in his Oscar-winning screenplay, Pulp Fiction.  If you love the film, read this, because it may answer any further questions you have about it, and you'll understand the movie a bit more.  I strongly recommend this book to anyone who highly admires Quentin Tarantino.
This screenplay is almost good as the film but You need to see the film to  see how good and great it is. The great thing about the screenplay is you  read parts that are not in the film.
although there are scenes that have been changed for the movie 99% Is exactly like the motion picture. I love this book and its a testament to Tarantino that I own this screen play.
What a pleasure to read this screenplay. The book was always out of stock, but I finally got it and I'm absolutely satisfied with my purchase.
